name: C. Division by Two and Permutation
statement:
You are given an array a consisting of n positive integers. You can
perform operations on it.In one operation you can replace any element of
the array a_i with
lfloor
frac{a_i}{2}
rfloor, that is, by an integer part of dividing a_i by 2 (rounding
down).See if you can apply the operation some number of times (possible
0) to make the array a become a permutation of numbers from 1 to n that
is, so that it contains all numbers from 1 to n, each exactly once.For
example, if a = [1, 8, 25, 2], n = 4, then the answer is yes. You could
do the following: Replace 8 with
lfloor
frac{8}{2}
rfloor = 4, then a = [1, 4, 25, 2]. Replace 25 with
lfloor
frac{25}{2}
rfloor = 12, then a = [1, 4, 12, 2]. Replace 12 with
lfloor
frac{12}{2}
rfloor = 6, then a = [1, 4, 6, 2]. Replace 6 with
lfloor
frac{6}{2}
rfloor = 3, then a = [1, 4, 3, 2].
